sensortoolkit.plotting._timeseries.sensor_timeplotÔÉÅ

sensor_timeplot(df_list, ref_df, param=None, sensor_name=None, figure_path=None, bdate=None, edate=None, write_to_file=True, sensor_serials=None, ref_name=None, averaging_interval=None, return_mpl_obj=True, report_fmt=False, ax=None, fig=None, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate a timeplot for a specified pollutant alongside FRM/FEM concentration values.

Parameters

  • df_list (list) ‚Äì List of Pandas dataframes containing sensor data.

  • ref_df (pandas DataFrame) ‚Äì Reference dataset.

  • param (str, optional) ‚Äì Column header name for the pollutant values to be plotted. Defaults to None.

  • sensor_name (str, optional) ‚Äì Unformatted sensor name, passed to Formatted_Sensor_Name() for including formatted version on plot. Defaults to None.

  • figure_path (str, optional) ‚Äì Path to directory where the figure will be saved. Defaults to None.

  • bdate (str, optional) ‚Äì Date (‚Äòyyyy-mm-dd‚Äô format) for beginning of timeseries plot. Defaults to None.

  • edate (str, optional) ‚Äì Date (‚Äòyyyy-mm-dd‚Äô format) for end of timeseries plot. Defaults to None.

  • write_to_file (bool, optional) ‚Äì If true, figure is written to file and interactive plot is closed. Defaults to True.

  • sensor_serials (dict, optional) ‚Äì Optional pass sensor serials dictionary to plot sensor serial IDs in the legend instead of numbered sensors. Defaults to None.

  • ref_name (str, optional) ‚Äì The name of the FRM/FEM monitor (make and model). Defaults to None.

  • averaging_interval (str, optional) ‚Äì The measurement averaging intervals commonly utilized for analyzing data corresponding the the selected parameter. Defaults to None.

  • return_mpl_obj (bool, optional) ‚Äì If true, will return a Matplotlib axes instance (useful for iteration over subplot axes if this plotting function is called within a for-loop that is iterating over the axes elements in a Matplotlib subplot object). Defaults to True.

  • report_fmt (bool, optional) ‚Äì If true, select formatting presets for displaying figures on the reporting template for sensor performance evaluations included alongside US EPA‚Äôs performance targets documents for air sensors. Defaults to False.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot, optional) ‚Äì Optional, the Matplotlib Axes object on which plotting elements will be drawn. Useful is the user is iterating over the Axes elements of a Matplotlib figure in a for-loop outside this plotting function. Within the loop, calls to this function can be made to add elements for each axes object. Defaults to None.

  • fig (Matplotlib.figure.Figure, optional) ‚Äì Optional, the Matplotlib figure on which axes object elements are drawn. Useful is the user is iterating over the Axes elements of a Matplotlib figure in a for-loop outside this plotting function. Within the loop, calls to this function can be made to add elements for each axes object. Defaults to None.

Keyword Arguments:

Parameters

  • seaborn_style (str) ‚Äì The plotting style based on seaborn‚Äôs style options. Defaults to ‚Äòdarkgrid‚Äô. Values must be a valid seaborn style name.

  • date_interval (int) ‚Äì Number of days between x-axis tick marks with ‚Äòmm-dd-yy‚Äô timestamps.

  • yscale (str) ‚Äì The scaling for the y-axis. Accepted values include ‚Äòlinear‚Äô, ‚Äòlog‚Äô, ‚Äòsymlog‚Äô, ‚Äòlogit‚Äô, etc.

  • ylims (Two-element tuple of floats or ints) ‚Äì Set the y-limits of the plot.

  • format_xaxis_weeks (bool) ‚Äì Plot the timeseries x-axis (time) in increments of 1 week. Defaults to False.

  • fig_size (Two-element tuple) ‚Äì The dimensions (width, height) in inches of the Matplotlib figure to be drawn. Defaults to (16, 3.5).

  • float (fontsize int or) ‚Äì The font size for the xlabel, ylabel, and plot text. Passed on to Draw_Scatter() which uses 0.85*font_size for tick labels.

  • legend_fontscale (font) ‚Äì Relative scale of fontsize for text in the legend relative to label text.

  • cmap_name (str) ‚Äì The name of the Matplotlib colormap that will be used when drawing plot elements. Defaults to 'Set1'. A full list of colormaps is can be found in the Matplotlib documentation

  • cmap_normrange (Two-element tuple) ‚Äì Normalized range (0,1) for colormap hue selection. Limiting this range to something like (0.1, 0.9) is useful when using colormaps with high contrast extrema and a gradual change in hue is desired for plots.

  • show_title (bool) ‚Äì If true, display the title for the figure. Defaults to True.

  • filename_suffix (str) ‚Äì Optional string added to end of filename. Defaults to empty string.

  • box_xscale (float) ‚Äì Scalar value for translating the x-coordinates of the Matplotlib axes object box in which the plot is drawn. Passed to the Matplotlib.Axes.set_position() method for adjusting the axes box dimensions relative to the Matplotlib figure coordinates.

  • box_yscale (float) ‚Äì Scalar value for translating the y-coordinates of the Matplotlib axes object box in which the plot is drawn. Passed to the Matplotlib.Axes.set_position() method for adjusting the axes box dimensions relative to the Matplotlib figure coordinates.

  • box_wscale (float) ‚Äì Scalar value for transforming the x-range (width) of the Matplotlib axes object box in which the plot is drawn. Passed to the Matplotlib.Axes.set_position() method for adjusting the axes box dimensions relative to the Matplotlib figure coordinates.

  • box_hscale (float) ‚Äì Scalar value for transforming the y-range (height) of the Matplotlib axes object box in which the plot is drawn. Passed to the Matplotlib.Axes.set_position() method for adjusting the axes box dimensions relative to the Matplotlib figure coordinates.

  • legend_loc (Two-element tuple) ‚Äì The x and y coordinate of center of the legend (relative to the axes object coordinates).

  • sensor_colors (list) ‚Äì Set the list of colors for drawing sensor line plots. Default set by chosen colormap (cmap_name) and the normalized range for the colormap.

  • sensor_linealpha (float) ‚Äì The transparency of the lines indicating sensor measurements. Defaults to 0.70.

  • sensor_linewidth (float) ‚Äì The width (thickness) of the lines indicating sensor measurements. Defaults to 1.5.

  • sensor_linestyle (str) ‚Äì The style of the lines indicating sensor measurements. Passed to matplotlib linestyles. Defaults to ‚Äò-‚Äò.

  • ref_linecolor (str) ‚Äì The color of the line indicating reference measurements. Defaults to ‚Äòk‚Äô.

  • ref_linealpha (float) ‚Äì The transparency of the line indicating reference measurements. Defaults to 0.97.

  • ref_linewidth (float) ‚Äì The width (thickness) of the line indicating reference measurements. Defaults to 1.5.

  • ref_linestyle (str) ‚Äì The style of the lines indicating reference measurements. Passed to matplotlib linestyles. Defaults to ‚Äò-‚Äò.

  • date_format (str) ‚Äì The strftime format in which dates will be displayed along the x-axis if ‚Äòformat_xaxis_weeks‚Äô is False. Defaults to ‚Äú%m-%d-%y‚Äù.

  • legend_fontsize (float) ‚Äì Value by which to scale the legend text font size relative to the value of the fontsize argument. Defaults to 0.72.

  • subplots_adjust (Four-element tuple.) ‚Äì Modify the bounds of the subplot [x-min, x-max, y-max, y-min]. If unique_ax_obj is True, defaults to (0.05, 0.9, 0.90, 0.15).

Returns

If return_mpl_obj is True or report_fmt is True, return ax object, else return None.

Return type

ax (matplotlib axes object)
